Legal_Issue: Whether the IAD erred in finding the medical opinion insufficient and vague
Governing_Law: s. 19(1)(a)(ii) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Facts: Principal claimant diagnosed with aortic valvular disease; Dr. Sorokin provided medical opinion on condition
Decision_Outcome: IAD's decision set aside; matter remanded for rehearing
Court_Ruling: Judicial review allowed; IAD overstepped jurisdiction by questioning medical opinion without contradictory evidence
Defendant_Behavior: IAD questioned medical prognosis and interpreted 'long term' and 'short term' unduly strictly
Grounds_for_Claim: Medical opinion deemed insufficient and vague by IAD without basis
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard; IAD cannot second-guess medical opinion unless manifestly unreasonable
Assessment_Factor: Potential excessive demand on health services due to medical condition
Procedural_Issue: IAD exceeded jurisdiction in assessing medical evidence
Credibility_Assessment: IAD did not properly assess credibility of Dr. Sorokin's opinion
Evidence_Used: Dr. Sorokin's medical report on aortic valvular disease
Application_Basis: Risk of excessive demand on health services upon admission
Evidence_Assessed: Medical prognosis regarding long-term and short-term health implications
Relief_Sought: Overturning of IAD decision and remittal for redetermination
Governing_Rule: Under s. 19(1)(a)(ii), inadmissibility based on potential excessive demand on health services
Evidentiary_Deficiency: IAD required more specific data than legally necessary
Harm_Assessment: Potential strain on public health services due to chronic medical condition
Cause_Description: Principal claimant deemed medically inadmissible due to aortic valvular disease
Evidence_Handling: IAD misinterpreted medical terminology and failed to accept reasonable medical uncertainty
Legal_Provision_Violated: None; issue was misapplication of s. 19(1)(a)(ii)
Evidence_Issues: Lack of contradictory medical evidence to challenge Dr. Sorokin's opinion
Residency_Compliance: Sponsorship application under review; claimant not yet resident
Legal_Provision: s. 19(1)(a)(ii) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Jurisdictional_Issue: IAD acted beyond its authority by re-evaluating medical opinion without expert contradiction
Evidence_Assessment: IAD applied incorrect standard in evaluating sufficiency of medical opinion
Decision_Rationale: Medical opinions need not be certain; IAD must not substitute its view without countervailing evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: IAD imposed higher evidentiary burden than required by law
